poem:
**Market Dance**

shares rise,
collapse—
a fleeting waltz

Nvidia stirs,
a phoenix in digits;
$121.60
almost redemption

Microsoft entangles,
Teams in turmoil—
the EU's cold
gavel falls

elsewhere,
Canada awakens,
inflation whispers
ghosts between
oughts and wants;

our lives tangle
in the stock ticker's
measureless breath.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Nvidia shares on track to open higher after $500bn sell-off; Microsoft hit with EU antitrust charge over Teams – business live 2.06pm BST With less than 30 minutes to go until Wall Street opens, Nvidia is still on track for a small recovery. Shares in Nvidia are on track to open almost 3% higher, at $121.60, which would recover nearly half of Monday’s losses. 2.03pm BST Over in Canada, inflation has jumped unexpectedly. Consumer prices". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
